 34 /**
 35  *@private
 36  */
 37 function sendToJavaScript()
 38 {
 39 	//myTrace("arguments length" + arguments.length + arguments[0]);
 40 	var args = arguments[0];
 41 	if (args.targetType =="CollectionNode") {
 42 		//	myTrace("Recieved something from AS side");
 43 		ConnectSession.primarySession.collections[args.targetSharedId].receiveEvent(args);
 44 	} else if (args.targetType =="UserManager") {
 45 		var usrMgr = ConnectSession.primarySession.userManager;
 46 		if (args.type == "getUserMgr") {
 47 			//myTrace("Initializing User Manager");
 48 			usrMgr.initialize(args);
 49 			var evt = new Object();
 50 			evt.target = evt.currentTarget = ConnectSession.primarySession;
 51 			evt.type = "synchronizationChange";
 52 			evt.value = true;
 53 			this.LCCSReady = true;
 54 			ConnectSession.primarySession.dispatchEvent(evt);
 55 			//myTrace(usrMgr.myUserID);
 56 		} else {
 57 			usrMgr.receiveEvent(args);
 58 		}
 59 	} else if (args.targetType =="ConnectSession") {
 60 			if (args.type == "swfReady") {
 61 				var evt = new Object();
 62 				evt.target = evt.currentTarget = ConnectSession.primarySession;
 63 				evt.type = "swfReady";
 64 				ConnectSession.primarySession.dispatchEvent(evt);
 65 			} else {
 66 				var evt = new Object();
 67 				evt.target = evt.currentTarget = ConnectSession.primarySession;
 68 				evt.type = "synchronizationChange";
 69 				this.LCCSReady = args.value;
 70 				evt.value = args.value;
 71 				ConnectSession.primarySession.dispatchEvent(evt);
 72 			}
 73 	}
 74 }

 96 /**
 97  *@private
 98  * Its a standard solution that is cited on many websites to address scope issues
 99  */
100 function bindUsingClosure(func, obj) {
101     return function() {
102         	func.apply(obj, arguments);
103     };
104 }

106 /**
107  * @class The EventDispatcher class is the helper class for all classes that dispatch events.
108  * <p>The event model is similar to,but not the same as ActionScript's event model.
109  * Components generate and dispatch events and consume (listen to) other events. An object that requires information
110  * about another object's events registers a listener with that object. When an event occurs, the object dispatches
111  * the event to all registered listeners by calling a function that was requested during registration. To receive multiple
112  * events from the same object, you must register your listener for each event.</p>
113  *
114  * <p>Components have built-in events that you can handle in your JavaScript applications. You can also take advantage of the
115  * model to define your own event listeners outside of your applications, and define which methods of your custom listeners
116  * will listen to certain events. You can register listeners with the target object so that when the target object dispatches
117  * an event, the listeners get called.</p>
118  *
119  * @example
120  *      // Simple EventListener snippet that you would use for components that
121  *      //would dispatch events
122  *
123  *      //In the example below SimpleChatModel class would dispatch "historyChange"
124  *      //event whenever the chat history changes
125  *      //1) Add an event Listener
126  *      chatModel.addEventListener("historyChange", this);
127  *      ....
128  *      //2)Define your listener. Its function name should match the event type
129  *      //that it is listening to. So the reaction or actions to the event
130  *      // "historyChange" would be defined inside the function
131  *      function historyChange(evt) {
132  *      	document.form1.histArea.value = evt.target.history; 
133  *      }
134  *
135  * @example
136  *      //Defining your own CustomEvents.
137  *      //1) Register your class with the event listener.
138  *      EventDispatcher.initialize(YourClass);
139  *
140  *      //2) Create your custom event with all the necessay information that you
141  *      //would dispatch and that others would expect.
142  *      var evt = new Object();
143  *      evt.type = "EventType";
144  *      evt.target=evt.currentTarget = this;
145  *
146  *      //3) Dispatch Events as you need them using the dispatchEvent method.
147  *      //The scope of the dispatchEvent method is local.So you would have
148  *      //to add the "this."
149  *	this.dispatchEvent(evt);
150  * @constructor
151  */
152 EventDispatcher = function() {
153 }
154 
155 
156 EventDispatcher._removeEventListener = function(queue, event, handler)
157 {
158 	if (queue != undefined)
159 	{
160 		var l = queue.length;
161 		var i;
162 		for (i = 0; i < l; i++)
163 		{
164 			var o = queue[i];
165 			if (o == handler) {
166 				queue.splice(i, 1);
167 				return;
168 			}
169 		}
170 	}
171 }
172 
173 
174 /**
175  * Register your class that would need to dispatch events to notify other components
176  * @static
177  * @function
178  * @param object the object to receive the methods
179  * @example EventDispatcher.initialize(YourClass);
180  */
181 EventDispatcher.initialize = function(object)
182 {
183 	object.addEventListener = _fEventDispatcher.addEventListener;
184 	object.removeEventListener = _fEventDispatcher.removeEventListener;
185 	object.dispatchEvent = _fEventDispatcher.dispatchEvent;
186 	object.dispatchQueue = _fEventDispatcher.dispatchQueue;
187 	//myTrace("Dispatcher initialized " + object + " "+ object.dispatchEvent);
188 }
189 
190 // internal function for dispatching events
191 EventDispatcher.prototype.dispatchQueue = function(queueObj, eventObj)
192 {
193 	var queueName = "__q_" + eventObj.type;
194 	var queue = queueObj[queueName];
195 	if (queue != undefined)
196 	{
197 		var i;
198 		// loop it as an object so it resists people removing listeners during dispatching
199 		for (i in queue)
200 		{
201 			var o = queue[i];
202 			var oType = typeof(o);
203 			
204 			// a handler can be a function, object, or movieclip
205 			if (oType == "object" || oType == "movieclip")
206 			{
207 				// this is a backdoor implementation that
208 				// is not compliant with the standard
209 				if (o.handleEvent == undefined)
210 				{
211 					if (o[eventObj.type] != undefined)
212 						o[eventObj.type](eventObj);
213 				}
214 				else // this is the DOM3 way
215 				{
216 					o.handleEvent(eventObj);
217 				}
218 			}
219 			else // it is a function
220 			{
221 				o.apply(queueObj, [eventObj]);
222 			}
223 		}
224 	}
225 }
226 
227 /**
228  * Dispatches an event into the event flow.
229  * @function
230  * @param eventObj an Event or one of its subclasses describing the event
231  * @example
232  *      var evt = new Object();
233  *      evt.type = "EventType";
234  *      evt.target=evt.currentTarget = this;
235  *      this.dispatchEvent(evt);
236  */
237 EventDispatcher.prototype.dispatchEvent = function(eventObj)
238 {
239 	if (eventObj.target == undefined)
240 		eventObj.target = this;
241 	
242 	if (this[eventObj.type + "Handler"] != undefined)
243 		this[eventObj.type + "Handler"](eventObj);
244 	
245 	// Dispatch to objects that are registered as listeners for
246 	// this object.
247 	this.dispatchQueue(this, eventObj);
248 }
249 
250 /**
251  * Registers an event listener object with an EventDispatcher model so that the listener receives notification of an event.
252  * @function
253  * @param event the name of the event ("click", "change", etc)
254  * @param the function or object that should be called
255  * @example chatModel.addEventListener("historyChange", this);
256  */
257 EventDispatcher.prototype.addEventListener = function(event, handler)
258 {
259 	var queueName = "__q_" + event;
260 	if (this[queueName] == undefined)
261 	{
262 		this[queueName] = new Array();
263 	}
264 	//Not supported in asc, it shouldn't matter. _global.ASSetPropFlags(this, queueName,1);
265 	
266 	EventDispatcher._removeEventListener(this[queueName], event, handler);
267 	this[queueName].push(handler);
268 }
269 
270 /**
271  * Remove a listener for a particular event
272  * @function
273  * @param event the name of the event ("click", "change", etc)
274  * @param the function or object that should be called
275  * @example chatModel.removeEventListener("historyChange", this);
276  */
277 EventDispatcher.prototype.removeEventListener = function(event, handler)
278 {
279 	var queueName = "__q_" + event;
280 	EventDispatcher._removeEventListener(this[queueName], event, handler);
281 }
282 
283 _fEventDispatcher = new EventDispatcher();

289 /**
290  * @class ConnectSession is responsible to establish a session with LCCS.
291  * Its the Room's primary session that is passed from the invisible swf. It is responsible for the operation
292  * of the UserManager class and maintains the UserManager property to access them.
293  * <table><tr><th><b>Event</b></th><th><b>Summary</b></th></tr>
294  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>SynchronizationChange</code></td> <td>This event is dispatched when the <code>ConnectSession</code> establishes or loses its connection to the service</td></tr></table>
295  * @param p_bridgeSWF {string} The invisble swf's name that is responsible for the communication with the LCCS
296  *
297  * @example
298  * var cs = new ConnectSession("JSBridge"); //For WebKit based browsers
299  * @constructor
300  */
301 function ConnectSession(p_bridgeSWF)
302 {
303 	if (typeof(p_bridgeSWF)== "string") {
304 		if (navigator.appName.indexOf("Microsoft") != -1) {
305 		    p_bridgeSWF = window[p_bridgeSWF];
306 		} else {
307 		    p_bridgeSWF = document[p_bridgeSWF];
308 		}
309 	}
310 	this.bridgeSWF = p_bridgeSWF;
311 	ConnectSession.primarySession = this;
312 	this.userManager = new UserManager();
313 	this.addEventListener("swfReady",this);
314 }
315 EventDispatcher.initialize(ConnectSession.prototype);
316 /**
317  *The userManager of the room's Primary Connect Session
318  *@field userManager
319  */
320 ConnectSession.prototype.userManager = undefined;
321 /**
322  * (Required) The authenticator through which login information is passed.
323  * The authenticator object could have any of the following values.
324  * <ul>
325  * <li>userName - When <code>authenticationKey</code> is not used, <code>
326  * userName</code> is required upon room entry; when a someone enters as a guest, the name 
327  * becomes the user's display name.
328  * <p>
329  * Two cases are supported: 
330  * <ul>
331  * <li><strong>userName is supplied with no password</strong>: The user is logged in as 
332  * viewer and <code>UserDescriptor.displayName</code> is set to the value in 
333  * <code>userName</code>.
334  * 
335  * <li><strong>A username and password are supplied</strong>: <code>password</code>
336  * is only provided when members login with Adobe IDs which is an uncommon case. See below.
337  * </ul></li>
338  * <li>password - <code>password</code> is only required when Adobe IDs
339  * are used; therefore, it is likely that only developers would need this parameter except
340  * during development. If used, it is supplied in addition to 
341  * <code>userName</code> and permits admitting users as other than a guest. 
342  * Note that while it is possible for registered Adobe service users to use their Adobe ID, 
343  * applications will likely leverage LCCS's external authentication capabilities so that 
344  * <code>authenticationKey</code> would be used in lieu of a username and
345  * password.  </li>
346  * <li>authenticationURL - Allows a developer to specify the URL of a LCCS-compatible authentication service; 
347  * it is <strong>not needed</strong> for many applications.</li>
348  * </ul>
349  * Code example
350  * <code>
351  * 	connectSession.roomURL = "http://connectnow.acrobat.com/accountName/roomName";
352  * 	var auth = new Object();
353  * 	auth.userName = "username@xyz.com";
354  * 	auth.password = "password";
355  * 	connectSession.authenticator = auth;
356  * </code>
357  *@field userManager
358  */
359 ConnectSession.prototype.authenticator = undefined;
360 /**
361  * (Required) The URL of the room to which to connect.
362  *@field roomURL
363  */
364 ConnectSession.prototype.roomURL = undefined;
365 /**
366  *@private
367  */
368 ConnectSession.prototype.swfLoaded = false;
369 
370 /**
371  *@private
372  */
373 ConnectSession.prototype.loginFlag = false;
374 
375 /**
376  *@private
377  */
378 ConnectSession.prototype.subscribeCollection = function(p_collection)
379 {
380 	if (this.collections == null) {
381 		this.collections = new Object();
382 		this.collections[p_collection.sharedID] = p_collection;
383 	} else {
384 		this.collections[p_collection.sharedID] = p_collection;
385 	}
386 	//this.bridgeSWF.RTCIncoming("CollectionNode", "subscribeCollection", p_collection.sharedID)
387 	var args = new Object();
388 	args.sharedID = p_collection.sharedID;
389 	this.callLCCSMethod("CollectionNode", "subscribeCollection", args);
390 }
391 
392 /**
393  *@private
394  */
395 ConnectSession.prototype.publishItem = function(p_collection, p_messageItem)
396 {
397 	//this.bridgeSWF.RTCIncoming("CollectionNode", "publishItem", p_collection.sharedID, p_messageItem)
398 	var args = new Object();
399 	args.sharedID = p_collection.sharedID;
400 	args.messageItem = p_messageItem;
401 	this.callLCCSMethod("CollectionNode", "publishItem", args);
402 }
403 
404 /**
405  *@private
406  */
407 ConnectSession.prototype.swfReady = function(p_evt)
408 {
409 	this.swfLoaded = true;
410 	if (this.loginFlag) {
411 		this.loginFlag = false;
412 		this.login();
413 	}
414 }
415 
416 /**
417 * Logs into the RTC service. Calling login is required for using ConnectSession, as compared with ConnectSessionContainer,
418 * Which does so automatically.
419 * @function
420 */
421 ConnectSession.prototype.login = function() {
422 	if (this.authenticator && this.roomURL) {
423 		if (this.swfLoaded) {
424 			var roomURL = new Object();
425 			roomURL.roomURL = this.roomURL;
426 			this.callLCCSMethod("ConnectSession", "setRoomURL", roomURL);
427 			this.callLCCSMethod("ConnectSession", "setAuthenticator", this.authenticator);
428 			this.callLCCSMethod("ConnectSession", "login", null);
429 		} else {
430 			this.loginFlag = true;
431 		}
432 	}
433 }
434 
435 /**
436  * Logs out and disconnects from the session.
437  * @function
438  */
439 ConnectSession.prototype.logout = function() {
440 	this.callLCCSMethod("ConnectSession", "logout", null);
441 }
442 
443 /**
444  * Disposes all listeners to the network and framework classes.
445  * @function
446  */
447 ConnectSession.prototype.close = function() {
448 	this.callLCCSMethod("ConnectSession", "close", null);
449 }
450 
451 /**
452  * A function that indicates whether or not the ConnectSession is fully synchronized with the service.
453  * @function
454  */
455 ConnectSession.prototype.isSynchronized = function() {
456 	return this.LCCSReady;
457 }

459 /**
460  *@private
461  */
462 ConnectSession.prototype.callLCCSMethod = function(p_className,p_methodName, p_methodArgs)
463 {
464 	this.bridgeSWF.RTCIncoming(p_className, p_methodName, p_methodArgs);
465 }

554 /**
555  * @class UserManager is one of the "four pillars" of a room and is tasked with maintaining a list of the set of users in the room, along with their descriptors.
556  * It is also the primary class through which one publishes changes to a user role or other user information.
557  * <table><tr><th><b>Event</b></th><th><b>Summary</b></th></tr>
558  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>anonymousPresenceChange </code></td> <td>	 Dispatched when anonymousPresence is set in the UserManager  </td></tr>
559  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>customFieldChange</code></td> <td> Dispatched when a custom field value for a user has changed. </td></tr>
560  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>customFieldDelete</code></td> <td> Dispatched when a custom field for a user is deleted. </td></tr>
561  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>customFieldRegister</code></td> <td> Dispatched when a custom field for a user is registered. </td></tr>
562  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>synchronizationChange</code></td> <td> Dispatched when the UserManager has received everything up to the current state of the room or has lost the connection. </td></tr>
563  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>userBooted</code></td> <td> Dispatched when a user is forcibly ejected from the room.  </td></tr>
564  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>userConnectionChange</code></td> <td> Dispatched when a user's connection speed has changed. </td></tr>
565  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>userCreate</code></td> <td> Dispatched when a new user joins the room. </td></tr>
566  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>userNameChange</code></td> <td> Dispatched when the user's displayName has changed. </td></tr>
567  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>userPingDataChange</code></td> <td> Dispatched when a user's ping data has changed. </td></tr>
568  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>userRemove</code></td> <td> Dispatched when a user leaves the room. </td></tr>
569  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>userRoleChange</code></td> <td> Dispatched when the user's role has changed. </td></tr>
570  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>userUsericonURLChange</code></td> <td> Dispatched when a user's icon URL has changed. </td></tr>
571  * </table>
572  * @constructor
573  */
574 function UserManager()
575 {
576 	//Mention the fact that UserManager is not exactly a symmetrical copy of SDK's UserManager
577 	//While setting some properties, there is a possibility of a user not able to set some properties
578 	//So should set properties only if you are the room Owner
579 	
580 	//Flexible rights can be future upgrade. This would require some SDK changes as well
581 }
582 
583 EventDispatcher.initialize(UserManager.prototype);
584 
585 /**
586  *Determines whether all the others users in the room be revealed. Upon setting this property to true, users aren't revealed until explicitly called for.
587  *UserManager.userCollection and getUserDescriptor won't have any entry for any user (other than one's self) unless there's a specific request for that user.
588  *Any call to the getUserDescriptor will cause the UserManager to fetch that particular UserDescriptor and cache it, dispatching the usual userCreate event. 
589  *@field
590  */
591 UserManager.prototype.anonymousPresence = false;
592 /**
593  *An array of userIDs, which represents the set of users which might be listening for the current user's updates
594  *Note, this isn't the set of users the current user is listening for, but rather the inverse.
595  *The current user would notify users in the Array about all his activities. In other words the users in the Array users are listening to the current user even if he is not listening to them. 
596  *@field
597  */
598 UserManager.prototype.myBuddyList = new Array();
599 /**
600  *The current user's userID. 
601  *@field
602  */
603 UserManager.prototype.myUserID = "";
604 /**
605  *THe current user's userTicket
606  *@private 
607  *@field
608  */
609 UserManager.prototype.myTicket = "";
610 /**
611  *Specifies the current user's affiliation. 
612  *@field
613  */
614 UserManager.prototype.myUserAffiliation = 0;
615 /**
616  *Specifies the current user's role
617  *@field
618  */
619 UserManager.prototype.myUserRole = 0;
620 /**
621  *This field is set if anyone has peer to peer disabled. i.e. behind firewall or something...
622  *@field
623  */
624 UserManager.prototype.isPeerEnable = false;
625 /**
626  *Returns a sorted collection of user descriptors with root user roles of UserRoles.VIEWER (10).
627  *@field
628  */
629 UserManager.prototype.audienceCollection = new Object();
630 /**
631  *Returns a sorted collection of user descriptors with root user roles of UserRoles.OWNER (100).
632  *@field
633  */
634 UserManager.prototype.hostCollection = new Object();
635 /**
636  *Returns a sorted collection of user descriptors with root user roles of UserRoles.PUBLISHER (50).
637  *@field
638  */
639 UserManager.prototype.participantCollection = new Object();
640 /**
641  *internal storage for the entire set of users (hashed by userID)
642  *@private
643  *@field
644  */
645 UserManager.prototype.userDescriptorTable= new Object();
646 /**
647  *Specifies whether or not the UserManager has connected and has synchronized all of the user information from the service.
648  *The userManager of the room's Primary Connect Session
649  *@field
650  */
651 UserManager.prototype.isSynchronized=false;
652 /**
653  *Returns the list of all the custom fields created.
654  *@field
655  */
656 UserManager.prototype.customFieldNames = new Object();
657 /**
658  *Used to recreate the UserManager once the ConnectSession.primarySession's userManager is synchronized
659  *@function
660  *@private
661  */
662 UserManager.prototype.initialize = function(usrObj)
663 {
664 	for (var i in usrObj) {
665 		if (i != undefined && UserManager.prototype.hasOwnProperty(i)) {
666 			if(i == "audienceCollection" || i == "hostCollection" || i == "participantCollection") {
667 				//Might have to translate the values in the collection to UserDescriptor.
668 				this[i] = this.objectValuesToUserDescriptorUtility(usrObj[i]);
669 			} else {
670 				this[i] = usrObj[i];
671 			}
672 		}
673 	}
674 	this.isSynchronized = true;
675 	//myTrace("Just stopping to examine");
676 }
677 
678 /**
679  *@private
680  */
681 UserManager.prototype.objectValuesToUserDescriptorUtility = function(usrCollection,keyString)
682 {
683 	var usrObj = new Object();
684 	for (var i in usrCollection) {
685 		var usrDesc = new UserDescriptor();
686 		usrDesc.setValues(usrCollection[i]);
687 		var usrID = usrDesc.userID;
688 		//usrCollection[usrID] = usrDesc;
689 		usrObj[usrID] = usrDesc;
690 		this.userDescriptorTable[usrID] = usrDesc;
691 	}
692 	return usrObj;
693 	//this[keyString] = usrObj;
694 }

707 		this.connectSession.callLCCSMethod("UserManager", "setAnonymousPresence", args);

728 /**
729  * Fetches all available details about the specified user. If <code>anonymousPresence</code> is set to true,
730  * the method migth return a null if <code>UserDescriptor</code> was never fetched. In such a situation we must
731  * listen to <code>UserEvent.USER_CREATE</code> event and update the User's  <code>UserDescriptor</code> we wanted.
732  * 
733  * Note: If the <code>UserManager.anonymousPresence</code> is set to true, then this method might fail if the
734  * user's userDescriptor has not been fetched. So it is adviced to call this method after the required userDescriptor's
735  * are fetched.In other words listen to <code>UserEvent.USER_CREATE</code> event and call this method after the required
736  * userDescriptor's are fetched.
737  * @function
738  * @param p_userID The unique ID of the user being queried.
739  * @return The UserDescriptor of the specified user if <code>anonymousPresence</code> were false.
740  */
741 UserManager.prototype.getUserDescriptor = function(p_userID)
742 {
743 	if (this.userDescriptorTable[p_userID]) {
744 		return this.userDescriptorTable[p_userID];
745 	} else {
746 		if (this.anonymousPresence) {
747 			//fetchUserDescriptor(p_userID);
748 			var args = new Object();
749 			args.userID = p_userID;
750 			this.connectSession.callLCCSMethod("UserManager", "getUserDescriptor", args);
751 			return null;
752 		} else {
753 			return null;		
754 		}
755 	}
756 }

758 /**
759  * Promotes or demotes the specified user at the "root level". This is the primary 
760  * way to change a user's role (although it's also possible to change a user's role relative

773 	//publisher

775 		var args = new Object();
776 		args.userID = p_userID;
777 		args.role = p_userRole;

984 /**
985  * This function checks if anyone has peer to peer disabled. i.e. behind firewall or something...
986  * @returns {boolean} returns if the p2p is disabled.
987  * @function
988  */
989 UserManager.prototype.getIsPeerEnable = function()
990 {
991 	for (var i in this.userDescriptorTable) {
992 		if (!this.userDescriptorTable[i].isPeer) {
993 			return false;
994 		}
995 	}
996 	return true;
997 }

999 /*
1000 *@private
1001 */
1002 UserManager.prototype.updateUserTables = function(args)
1003 {
1004 	this.userDescriptorTable[args.value.userID] = args.value;
1005 	if (args.value.role == 100) {
1006 		this.hostCollection[args.value.userID] = args.value;
1007 	} else if (args.value.role == 50) {
1008 		this.participantCollection[args.value.userID] = args.value;
1009 	} else if(args.value.role <= 10){
1010 		this.audienceCollection[args.value.userID] = args.value;
1011 	}
1012 }
1013 
1014 /*
1015 * Internal helper method to dispatchEvents and morph arguments to objects and set the target & currentTarget
1016 *@private
1017 */
1018 UserManager.prototype.receiveEvent = function(args)
1019 {
1020 	var evt = new Object();
1021 	evt.type = args.type;
1022 	evt.currentTarget = evt.target = this;
1023 	if (evt.type == "anonymousPresenceChange") {
1024 		this.anonymousPresence  = args.value;
1025 	} else if (evt.type == "customFieldChange") {
1026 		if(this.isCustomFieldDefined(args.customFieldName)) {
1027 			this.customFieldNames[args.customFieldName] = args.value;
1028 		}
1029 	} else if (evt.type == "customFieldDelete") {
1030 		if(this.isCustomFieldDefined(args.value)) {
1031 			delete 	this.customFieldNames[args.value]
1032 		}
1033 	} else if (evt.type == "customFieldRegister") {
1034 		this.customFieldNames[args.value] = new Object();
1035 	} else if (evt.type == "synchronizationChange") {
1036 		this.isSynchronized = evt.value;
1037 	} else if (evt.type == "userBooted") {
1038 		if (this.userDescriptorTable[args.value.userID]) {
1039 			delete this.userDescriptorTable[args.value.userID];
1040 		}
1041 		if (args.value.role == 100 && this.hostCollection[args.value.userID]) {
1042 			delete this.hostCollection[args.value.userID];
1043 		} else if (args.value.role == 50 && this.participantCollection[args.value.userID]) {
1044 			delete this.participantCollection[args.value.userID];
1045 		} else if(args.value.role <= 10 && this.audienceCollection[args.value.userID]){
1046 			delete this.audienceCollection[args.value.userID];
1047 		}
1048 		evt.userID = args.value.userID;
1049 	} else if (evt.type == "userConnectionChange") {
1050 		this.updateUserTables(args);
1051 		evt.userID = args.value.userID;
1052 	} else if (evt.type == "userCreate") {
1053 		this.updateUserTables(args);
1054 		evt.userID = args.value.userID;
1055 	} else if (evt.type == "userNameChange") {
1056 		this.updateUserTables(args);
1057 		evt.userID = args.value.userID;
1058 	} else if (evt.type == "userPingDataChange") {
1059 		this.updateUserTables(args);
1060 		evt.userID = args.value.userID;
1061 	} else if (evt.type == "userRemove") {
1062 		delete this.userDescriptorTable[args.value.userID];
1063 		if (args.value.role == 100 && this.hostCollection[args.value.userID]) {
1064 			delete this.hostCollection[args.value.userID];
1065 		} else if (args.value.role == 50 && this.participantCollection[args.value.userID]) {
1066 			delete this.participantCollection[args.value.userID];
1067 		} else if(args.value.role <= 10 && this.audienceCollection[args.value.userID]){
1068 			delete this.audienceCollection[args.value.userID];
1069 		}
1070 		evt.userID = args.value.userID;
1071 	} else if (evt.type == "userRoleChange") {
1072 		this.userDescriptorTable[args.value.userID] = args.value;
1073 		if (args.value.role == 100) {
1074 			this.hostCollection[args.value.userID] = args.value;
1075 			if(this.participantCollection[args.value.userID] ) {
1076 				delete this.participantCollection[args.value.userID];
1077 			}
1078 			if(this.audienceCollection[args.value.userID] ) {
1079 				delete this.audienceCollection[args.value.userID];
1080 			}			
1081 		} else if (args.value.role == 50) {
1082 			this.participantCollection[args.value.userID] = args.value;
1083 			if(this.hostCollection[args.value.userID] ) {
1084 				delete this.hostCollection[args.value.userID];
1085 			}
1086 			if(this.audienceCollection[args.value.userID] ) {
1087 				delete this.audienceCollection[args.value.userID];
1088 			}
1089 			
1090 			
1091 		} else if(args.value.role <= 10){
1092 			this.audienceCollection[args.value.userID] = args.value;
1093 			if(this.participantCollection[args.value.userID] ) {
1094 				delete this.participantCollection[args.value.userID];
1095 			}
1096 			if(this.hostCollection[args.value.userID] ) {
1097 				delete this.hostCollection[args.value.userID];
1098 			}
1099 		}
1100 		evt.userID = args.value.userID;
1101 	} else if (evt.type == "userUsericonURLChange") {
1102 		this.updateUserTables(args);
1103 		evt.userID = args.value.userID;
1104 	}
1105 	this.dispatchEvent(evt);
1106 }

1109 
1110 /**
1111  * @class CollectionNode is the foundation class for building shared models requiring publish
1112  * and subscribe messaging. All shared classes including the sharedModel, sharedManager, 
1113  * and many pods use CollectionNodes in order to manage  messages, permissions, and roles.
1114  * <p>
1115  * At its core, a room can be logically seen as a group of CollectionNodes. For example, 
1116  * one CollectionNode is used in a chat pod, one within UserManager, and so on. CollectionNodes, 
1117  * in turn, are made up of nodes which can be thought of as permission-managed channels 
1118  * through which MessageItems are sent and received. Each node has its own NodeConfiguration 
1119  * which determines the permissions and storage policies sent through it.
1120  * </p>
1121  * <p>
1122  * CollectionNode is the main component class developers will create and interact with in order
1123  * accomplish the following: 
1124  * <ul>
1125  *  <li>Create message nodes.</li>
1126  *  <li>Publish MessageItems to those nodes.</li>
1127  *  <li>Subscribe to nodes.</li>
1128  *  <li>Configure nodes.</li>
1129  *  <li>Manage collection and node user roles.</li>
1130  * </ul>
1131  * Only users with a role of <code>UserRoles.OWNER</code> may create and configure collectionNodes. 
1132  * Users of <code>UserRoles.PUBLISHER</code> can typically publish MessageItems, and 
1133  * <code>UserRoles.VIEWER</code> may subscribe and receive messages. As such, it's typically 
1134  * the case that an owner set up the required CollectionNodes in a room before publishers may 
1135  * publish or viewers may receive MessageItems.
1136  * <p>
1137  * CollectionNodes do not store the items which pass through them even if they are stored on 
1138  * the services. Developers are advised to listen to the <code>ITEM_RECEIVE</code> event and 
1139  * store details as needed in their own models.
1140  * <table><tr><th><b>Event</b></th><th><b>Summary</b></th></tr>
1141  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>configurationChange </code></td> <td> Dispatched when a node within the collection has a change in its configuration (typically, its access-model).</td></tr>
1142  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>itemReceive</code></td> <td> Dispatched when a node within the collection receives an item.</td></tr>
1143  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>itemRetract</code></td> <td> Dispatched when a node within the collection retracts an item.</td></tr>
1144  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>myRoleChange</code></td> <td> Dispatched when the current user's role changes for the  collectionNode as a whole and not nodes within it.</td></tr>
1145  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>nodeCreate</code></td> <td> Dispatched when a node is created within the collection.</td></tr>
1146  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>nodeDelete</code></td> <td> Dispatched when a node is deleted within the collection.</td></tr>
1147  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>reconnect</code></td> <td> Dispatched when the collection has been disconnected from the server and is in the process of reconnecting and re-subscribing.</td></tr>
1148  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>synchronizationChange</code></td> <td> Dispatched when the collection has fully received all nodes and items stored up until the present time thereby becoming synchronized as well as when the collection becomes disconnected from (and thus "out of sync" with) the room's messaging bus.</td></tr>
1149  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>userRoleChange</code></td> <td> Dispatched when the collection or a node within the collection, has a change in roles for any user.</td></tr>
1150  * </table>
1151  *
1152  * @constructor
1153  */	
1154 function CollectionNode()
1155 {
1156 	this.connectSession = ConnectSession.primarySession;
1157 }
1158 EventDispatcher.initialize(CollectionNode.prototype);
1159 
1160 /**
1161  * The <code>sharedID</code> is the logical address of this collection 
1162  * within the room and must therefore be unique from all other CollectionNode names.
1163  * @field
1164  */
1165 CollectionNode.prototype.sharedID = "";
1166 /**
1167  * The ConnectSession with which this component is associated. Note that this may only be set once before <code>subscribe</code>
1168  * is called; re-sessioning of components is not supported.
1169  * @field
1170  */
1171 CollectionNode.prototype.connectSession = undefined;
1172 /**
1173  * Determines whether or not the collection is "up to state" with all previously 
1174  * stored items in its nodes. Once a CollectionNode has successfully connected 
1175  * to the service and retrieved all its nodes and messageItems, it is considered 
1176  * synchronized. If the connection is lost, it becomes unsynchronized until it 
1177  * fully reconnects and re-retrieves its state.
1178  * @field
1179  */
1180 CollectionNode.prototype.isSynchronized = false;
1181 /**
1182  *@private
1183  *@field
1184  */
1185 CollectionNode.prototype.messageNodes;
1186 /**
1187  * @private
1188  * @field
1189  */
1190 CollectionNode.prototype.nodeUserRoles;
1191 /**
1192  * The complete set of roles for this collection described as {userID:role} pairs.
1193  * @field
1194  */
1195 CollectionNode.prototype.userRoles = undefined;
1196 
1197 /**
1198  * <code>subscribe()</code> causes the CollectionNode to subscribe to the logical 
1199  * destination provided by <code>collectionName</code>. If there is no such 
1200  * destination on the service and the current user has an owner role, a new 
1201  * CollectionNode is created and stored on the service with the given <code>
1202  * collectionName</code>.
1203  * When subscription is successful or a new CollectionNode is created, the collection:
1204  * <ul>
1205  * <li>Discovers all the accessible nodes for this collection along with 
1206  * their configurations and roles.</li>
1207  * <li>Subscribes to all nodes allowed within the collection.</li>																</li>
1208  * <li>Retrievs all stored items for all nodes within it and broadcasts <code>
1209  * ITEM_RECEIVE</code> events for each.</li>
1210  * <li>Fires a <code>COLLECTION_SYNCHRONIZE</code> event once the collection 
1211  * has retrieved the data above.</li>
1212  * </ul>
1213  * @function
1214  */		
1215 CollectionNode.prototype.subscribe = function()
1216 {
1217 	this.connectSession.subscribeCollection(this);
1218 }
1219 
1220 /**
1221  * Determines whether or not the collection is empty, that is, having no nodes
1222  * @return Boolean
1223  * @function
1224  */
1225 CollectionNode.prototype.isEmpty = function()
1226 {
1227 	for (var i in this.messageNodes)
1228 	{
1229 		return true;
1230 	}
1231 	return false;
1232 }

1237  * the CollectionNode will attempt to reconnect automatically.
1238  * @function
1239  */
1240 CollectionNode.prototype.unsubscribe = function()
1241 {
1242 	args.sharedID = this.sharedID;
1243 	this.connectSession.callLCCSMethod("CollectionNode", "unsubscribe");
1244 }

1311 /**
1312  * Gives a specific user a specific role level for this entire collection or optionally 
1313  * a specified node within it. Roles cascade down from the root level of the room to 
1314  * the CollectionNode level and then to the node level. The following override rules apply: 
1315  * <ul>
1316  * <li>Setting a role on a collection node overrides the role at the root for that collection node.
1317  * <li>Setting a role on a node overrides both the role at the root and the collection node for that node.
1318  * </ul>
1319  * 
1320  * @param p_userID The desired user's <code>userID</code>.
1321  * @param p_role The users new role.
1322  * @param p_nodeName [Optional, defaults to null] The UserRole for the entire CollectionNode
1323  * @function
1324  */
1325 CollectionNode.prototype.setUserRole = function(p_userID, p_role, p_nodeName)
1326 {
1327 	var args = new Object();
1328 	args.userID = p_userID;
1329 	args.role = p_role;
1330 	args.nodeName = p_nodeName;
1331 	args.sharedID = this.sharedID;
1332 	this.connectSession.callLCCSMethod("CollectionNode", "setUserRole", args);
1333 }
1334 
1335 /**
1336  * Gets the role of a given user for this collection or a node within it. Note that this 
1337  * function discovers the implicit or cascading role of the user at this location; that is, 
1338  * if no explicit role is specified for a node, the user's role on the parent collection's 
1339  * is queried. If the user's role isn't explicitly defined on the collection, the root role 
1340  * is queried.
1341  * 
1342  * @param p_userID The user whose role is being queried.
1343  * @param p_nodeName [Optional, defaults to null]. The name of the node to check for roles. 
1344  * If null, check the entire CollectionNode.
1345  * 
1346  * @return the level of role of the specified user
1347  *
1348  * @function
1349  * 
1350  */
1351 CollectionNode.prototype.getUserRole = function(p_userID,p_nodeName)
1352 {
1353 	if (this.isNodeDefined(p_nodeName)) {
1354 		if (this.getExplicitUserRole(p_userID, p_nodeName) != -999) {
1355 			return this.getExplicitUserRole(p_userID, p_nodeName);
1356 		} else {
1357 			return this.getRootUserRole(p_userID);
1358 		}
1359 	} else {
1360 		return this.getRootUserRole(p_userID);
1361 	}
1362 }
1363 
1364 /**
1365  * Finds the room-level userRole for a user
1366  * @private
1367  */
1368 CollectionNode.prototype.getRootUserRole = function(p_userID)
1369 {
1370 	if (this.userRoles && this.userRoles[p_userID]) {
1371 		return this.userRoles[p_userID];
1372 	} else {
1373 		var usrRole = this.connectSession.userManager.getUserRole(p_userID);
1374 		if (usrRole) {
1375 			return usrRole;
1376 		} else {
1377 			//something wrong
1378 			return null;
1379 		}
1380 	}
1381 }
1382 
1383 /**
1384  * Gets the roles explicitly set for a node within this collection. This only returns the 
1385  * explicit roles set on the particular node and doesn't look up the cascading roles from
1386  * the root as <code>getUserRole()</code> does.
1387  * 
1388  * @param p_userID The user whose role is being queried.
1389  * @param p_nodeName The name of the node to whose roles are desired. If null, returns the 
1390  * set of user roles at the collection node level.
1391  * 
1392  * @return An object table of <code>{userID:role}</code> tuples.
1393  * @function
1394  */
1395 CollectionNode.prototype.getExplicitUserRoles = function(p_nodeName)
1396 {
1397 	if (this.isNodeDefined(p_nodeName)) {
1398 		return this.nodeUserRoles[p_nodeName];
1399 	}else {
1400 		return this.userRoles;
1401 	}
1402 }
1403 
1404 /**
1405  * Gets the role of a given user for a node within this collection or the 
1406  * collection itself. This only returns the explicit roles set on the 
1407  * particular node and doesn't look up the cascading roles from the root 
1408  * as <code>getUserRole()</code> does.
1409  * 
1410  * @param p_userID The user whose role is being queried.
1411  * @param p_nodeName The name of the node to whose roles are desired. 
1412  * Null for the collection itself.
1413  * 
1414  * @return The requested role. If the role for the user isn't explicitly 
1415  * set, it returns <code>NO_EXPLICIT_ROLE</code>.
1416  * @function
1417  */
1418 
1419 CollectionNode.prototype.getExplicitUserRole = function(p_userID,p_nodeName)
1420 {
1421 	if (this.isNodeDefined(p_nodeName)) {
1422 		var tmpObject = this.nodeUserRoles[p_nodeName];
1423 		if (tmpObject) {
1424 			return tmpObject[p_userID];
1425 		}
1426 	} else {
1427 		if (this.userRoles && this.userRoles[p_userID]) {
1428 			return this.userRoles[p_userID];
1429 		}
1430 	}
1431 	return -999;
1432 }
1433 
1434 /**
1435  * Determines whether a given user is allowed to subscribe to this entire collection 
1436  * or a node within it.
1437  * 
1438  * @param p_userID The ID of the user whose role is being queried.
1439  * @param p_nodeName [Optional, null if empty]. The node to check. If null, it 
1440  * checks the entire CollectionNode.
1441  * @function
1442  */
1443 CollectionNode.prototype.canUserSubscribe = function(p_userID,p_nodeName)
1444 {
1445 	if (p_nodeName==null) {
1446 		return (this.getUserRole(p_userID)>=10);
1447 	} else {
1448 		var roleNeededToSubscribe = this.getNodeConfiguration(p_nodeName).accessModel;
1449 		return (getUserRole(p_userID, p_nodeName)>=roleNeededToSubscribe);
1450 	}
1451 }
1452 
1453 /**
1454  * Determines whether a given user is allowed to publish to a given node in 
1455  * this collection.
1456  * 
1457  * @param p_userID The ID of the user whose role (and therefore permissions) is being queried.
1458  * @param p_nodeName The name of the desired node. 
1459  * 
1460  * @return 
1461  * @function
1462  */		
1463 CollectionNode.prototype.canUserPublish = function(p_userID,p_nodeName)
1464 {
1465 	if (!this.isNodeDefined(p_nodeName)) {
1466 		return (this.getUserRole(p_userID, p_nodeName)>=100);
1467 	}
1468 	var roleNeededToPublish = this.getNodeConfiguration(p_nodeName).publishModel;
1469 	if (roleNeededToPublish) {
1470 		return (this.getUserRole(p_userID, p_nodeName)>=roleNeededToPublish);
1471 	} else {
1472 		return (this.getUserRole(p_userID, p_nodeName)>=100);
1473 	}
1474 }
1475 
1476 /**
1477  * Determines whether a given user is allowed to configue this collection. 
1478  * 
1479  * @param p_userID The ID of the user whose role (and therefore permissions) is being queried.
1480  * @param p_nodeName Optionally, the name of the requested node. Defaults to the collection.
1481  *
1482  * @return 
1483  * @function
1484  */		
1485 CollectionNode.prototype.canUserConfigure = function(p_userID,p_nodeName)
1486 {
1487 	if (p_nodeName==null) {
1488 		return (this.getUserRole(p_userID)>=100);
1489 	} else {
1490 		return (this.canUserPublish(p_userID, p_nodeName) && this.getUserRole(p_userID, p_nodeName)>=100);
1491 	}
1492 }
1493 
1494 /**
1495  * Retracts the indicated item. This removes the item from storage on the server and 
1496  * sends an <code>itemRetract</code> event to all users.
1497  *

1499  * @param p_itemID The <code>itemID</code> of the <code>messageItem</code> (stored on the server) 
1500  * to retract.
1501  * @function
1502  */
1503 CollectionNode.prototype.retractItem = function(p_nodeName,p_itemID)
1504 {
1505 	var args = new Object();
1506 	args.itemID = p_itemID;
1507 	args.nodeName = p_nodeName;
1508 	args.sharedID = this.sharedID;
1509 	this.connectSession.callLCCSMethod("CollectionNode", "retractItem", args);
1510 }

1512 /**
1513  * Fetches the set of items specified by itemIDs from a given node. This will result in one <code>ITEM_RECEIVE</code> event
1514  * per item retrieved, for the current user. Attempts to fetch items which don't exist fails silently.
1515  * @param p_nodeName The name of the node from which to fetch the items.
1516  * @param p_itemIDs An array of <code>itemID<code>s (Strings) to fetch from the service.
1517  * @function
1518  */
1519 CollectionNode.prototype.fetchItems = function(p_nodeName,p_itemIDs)
1520 {
1521 	var args = new Object();
1522 	args.itemIDs = p_itemIDs;
1523 	args.nodeName = p_nodeName;
1524 	args.sharedID = this.sharedID;
1525 	this.connectSession.callLCCSMethod("CollectionNode", "fetchItems", args);

1528 /**
1529  * Whether the given node exists in this CollectionNode.
1530  * 
1531  * @param p_nodeName the name of desired node 
1532  * @return 
1533  * @function
1534  */
1535 CollectionNode.prototype.isNodeDefined = function(p_nodeName)
1536 {
1537 	if (this.messageNodes && this.messageNodes[p_nodeName]) {
1538 		return true;
1539 	} else {
1540 		return false;
1541 	}
1542 }

1549 
1550 /**
1551  * Publishes a MessageItem. The MessageItem itself will have a <code>nodeName</code> declared.
1552  * <p>
1553  * <code>p_overWrite</code> provides users with control over whether edits take 
1554  * precedence over delete actions. It is essentially a lock that assures an item can
1555  * only be published if it exists. The general rule of thumb is that if you 
1556  * want to add a new item, use the <code>p_overWrite</code> default flag of false. 
1557  * If you're editing an item that may be retracted, then set the flag according to 
1558  * your preference. 
1559  * <p>
1560  * 
1561  * @param p_messageItem The MessageItem to publish.
1562  * @param p_overWrite True if this call is overwriting an existing item. False (the default) 
1563  * if it is not.
1564  * @function
1565  */
1566 
1567 CollectionNode.prototype.publishItem = function(p_messageItem)
1568 {
1569 	// check, am I synchronized?
1570 	this.connectSession.publishItem(this, p_messageItem);
1571 }
1572 
1573 /*
1574 * Internal Method to dispatchEvents and morph arguments to objects and set the target & currentTarget
1575 *@private
1576 */
1577 CollectionNode.prototype.receiveEvent = function(args)
1578 {
1579 	args.currentTarget = args.target = this;
1580 	//myTrace("Recieved Event - " + args.type);
1581 	if (args.type == "synchronizationChange" && args.value) {
1582 		this.isSynchronized = args.value;
1583 		this.nodeUserRoles = args.nodeRoles;
1584 		this.userRoles = args.userRoles;
1585 		//this.messageNodes = new Object();
1586 		//this.messageNodes = args.nodes;
1587 	}
1588 	if (args.type == "itemReceive" && !this.isSynchronized) {
1589 		//return;
1590 	}
1591 	
1592 	if (args.type == "nodeCreate" || args.type == "configurationChange") {
1593 		if (!this.messageNodes) {
1594 			this.messageNodes = new Object();
1595 		}
1596 		this.messageNodes[args.nodeName] = args.nodeConfiguration;
1597 	}
1598 	
1599 	if (args.type == "nodeDelete") {
1600 		delete this.messageNodes[args.nodeName];
1601 	}
1602 	
1603 	if (args.type == "myRoleChange" || args.type == "userRoleChange") {
1604 		if (args.nodeName) {
1605 			var nodeObject = this.nodeUserRoles[args.nodeName];
1606 			nodeObject[args.userID] = args.role;
1607 		}else {
1608 			this.userRoles[args.userID] = args.role;
1609 		}
1610 	}
1611 	this.dispatchEvent(args);
1612 }
1613 
1614 
1615 /**
1616  * @class SharedObject is used to store data in an unordered hash (key-value) across the AFCS services; elements can only be accessed using its key.
1617  * A SharedObject can be used in situations where you need to access a property using its key value as opposed to
1618  * index. Similar to SharedCollection and SharedProperty,this component supports "piggybacking" on existing CollectionNodes,
1619  * through its <code>collectionNode</code> property and its subscribe method. Developers can avoid CollectionNode
1620  * proliferation in their applications by pre-supplying a CollectionNode (to the <code>collectionNode</code> property)
1621  * and a nodeName (in the subscribe method) for the SharedObject to use. If none is supplied, the SharedObject will create its own 
1622  * collectionNode (named for the uniqueID supplied in subscribe()) for sending and receiving messages.
1623  * <table><tr><th><b>Event</b></th><th><b>Summary</b></th></tr>
1624  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>propertyAdd </code></td> <td> Dispatched when an item to SharedObject is added.</td></tr>
1625  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>propertyChange</code></td> <td> Dispatched when the SharedObject has been updated in some way.</td></tr>
1626  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>propertyRetracted</code></td> <td> Dispatched when an item from SharedObject is removed.</td></tr>
1627  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>reconnect</code></td> <td> The type of event emitted when the CollectionNode is about to reconnect to the server.</td></tr>
1628  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>synchronizationChange</code></td> <td> Dispatched when the SharedObject goes in and out of sync with the service.</td></tr>
1629  * </table>
1630  * @constructor
1631  */
1632 function SharedObject()
1633 {
1634 	this.connectSession = ConnectSession.primarySession;
1635 }
1636 EventDispatcher.initialize(SharedObject.prototype);
1637 
1638 /**
1639  * Defines the logical location of the component on the service - typically this assigns the sharedID of the collectionNode
1640  * used by the component. sharedIDs should be unique within a room (if they're expressing 2 unique locations). Note that
1641  * this can only be assigned once (before <code>subscribe()</code> is called). For components with an <code>id</code> property, 
1642  * sharedID defaults to that value.
1643  * @field
1644  */
1645 SharedObject.prototype.sharedID = "_SharedObject";
1646 /**
1647  * Specifies an existing collectionNode to use in case a developer wishes to supply their own, and avoid having the 
1648  * sharedObject create a new one.
1649  * @field
1650  */
1651 SharedObject.prototype.collectionNode = undefined;
1652 /**
1653  * The ConnectSession with which this component is associated. Note that this may only be set once before <code>subscribe</code>
1654  * is called; re-sessioning of components is not supported.
1655  * @field
1656  */
1657 SharedObject.prototype.connectSession = undefined;
1658 /**
1659  * Sets the Node Configuration on a already defined node that holds the sharedObject
1660  * @field
1661  */
1662 SharedObject.prototype.nodeConfiguration = undefined;
1663 /**
1664  * Sets the Node name for the node being created
1665  * @field
1666  */
1667 SharedObject.prototype.nodeName = "sharedObjectNode";
1668 /**
1669  *@private
1670  */
1671 SharedObject.prototype.myUserID;
1672 /**
1673  *@private
1674  */
1675 SharedObject.prototype.sharedObject = new Object(); 
1676 
1677 /**
1678  * Returns whether or not the SharedObject has retrieved any information previously stored on the service, and 
1679  * is currently connected to the service.
1680  * @returns {boolean}
1681  * @function
1682  */
1683 SharedObject.prototype.isSynchronized = function()
1684 {
1685 	if (this.collectionNode) {
1686 		return this.collectionNode.isSynchronized;
1687 	} else {
1688 		return false;
1689 	}
1690 }
1691 
1692 /**
1693  * Sets the Node Configuration on a already defined node that holds the sharedObject
1694  * @param p_nodeConfig The Node Configuration
1695  * @function
1696  */
1697 SharedObject.prototype.setNodeConfiguration = function(p_nodeConfig)
1698 {
1699 	this.nodeConfiguration = p_nodeConfig ;
1700 	if ( this.collectionNode.isSynchronized ) {
1701 		this.collectionNode.setNodeConfiguration(this.nodeName,this.nodeConfiguration);
1702 	}
1703 }
1704 
1705 
1706 /**
1707  *  Sets the role of a given user for the SharedObject.
1708  * 
1709  * @param p_userRole The role value to set on the specified user.
1710  * @param p_userID The ID of the user whose role should be set.
1711  * @function
1712  */
1713 SharedObject.prototype.setUserRole = function(p_userID ,p_userRole)
1714 {
1715 	if ( p_userID == null ) {
1716 		return ;
1717 	}
1718 	this.collectionNode.setUserRole(p_userID,p_userRole);
1719 }
1720 
1721 
1722 /**
1723  *  Returns the role of a given user for the SharedObject.
1724  * 
1725  * @param p_userID The user ID for the user being queried.
1726  * @function
1727  */
1728 SharedObject.prototype.getUserRole = function(p_userID)
1729 {
1730 	if ( p_userID == null ) {
1731 		return null;
1732 	}
1733 	return this.collectionNode.getUserRole(p_userID);
1734 }
1735 
1736 
1737 
1738 /**
1739  * Tells the component to begin synchronizing with the service.  
1740  * For "headless" components such as this one, this method must be called explicitly.
1741  * @function
1742  */
1743 SharedObject.prototype.subscribe = function()
1744 {
1745 	if ( !this.nodeConfiguration) {
1746 		this.nodeConfiguration = new NodeConfiguration();
1747 	}
1748 	
1749 	//this.nodeConfiguration.itemStorageScheme = NodeConfiguration.STORAGE_SCHEME_MANUAL;
1750 	this.nodeConfiguration.itemStorageScheme = 2;
1751 	if (!this.collectionNode) {
1752 		this.collectionNode = new CollectionNode();
1753 		this.collectionNode.sharedID = this.sharedID ;
1754 		this.collectionNode.connectSession = this.connectSession;
1755 		this.collectionNode.addEventListener("synchronizationChange", this);
1756 		this.collectionNode.addEventListener("itemReceive", this);
1757 		this.collectionNode.addEventListener("itemRetract", this);
1758 		this.collectionNode.subscribe();
1759 	}
1760 }
1761 
1762 /**
1763  * Disposes all listeners to the network and framework classes. 
1764  * Recommended for proper garbage collection of the component.
1765  * @function
1766  */
1767 SharedObject.prototype.close = function()
1768 {
1769 	this.collectionNode.removeEventListener("synchronizationChange", this);
1770 	this.collectionNode.removeEventListener("itemReceive", this);
1771 	this.collectionNode.removeEventListener("itemRetract", this);
1772 	this.collectionNode.removeEventListener("reconnect", this);
1773 	this.collectionNode.unsubscribe();
1774 	this.collectionNode = null;
1775 }
1776 
1777 /**
1778  * @private
1779  */
1780 SharedObject.prototype.synchronizationChange = function(p_evt)
1781 {
1782 	if ( this.collectionNode.isSynchronized ) {
1783 		this.myUserID = this.connectSession.userManager.myUserID;
1784 		if (!this.collectionNode.isNodeDefined(this.nodeName) && this.collectionNode.canUserConfigure(this.myUserID, this.nodeName)) {
1785 			// this collectionNode has never been built, and I can add it...
1786 			this.collectionNode.createNode(this.nodeName, this.nodeConfig);
1787 		}
1788 	}
1789 	p_evt.target = p_evt.currentTarget = this;
1790 	p_evt.value = p_evt.isSynchronized = true;
1791 	this.dispatchEvent(p_evt);
1792 }
1793 
1794 /**
1795  * @private
1796  */
1797 SharedObject.prototype.reconnect = function(p_evt)
1798 {
1799 	this.sharedObject = new Object();
1800 	p_evt.target = p_evt.currentTarget = this;
1801 	this.dispatchEvent(p_evt);
1802 }
1803 
1804 /**
1805  * @private
1806  */
1807 SharedObject.prototype.itemReceive = function(p_evt)
1808 {
1809 	//update the Object
1810 	if (p_evt.nodeName!=this.nodeName) {
1811 		return;
1812 	}
1813 	var newItemToAdd = p_evt.item;
1814 	
1815 	var eventType = (this.sharedObject[newItemToAdd.itemID]) ? "propertyChange" : "propertyAdd";
1816 	p_evt.type = eventType;
1817 	p_evt.itemID = newItemToAdd.itemID;
1818 	p_evt.value = newItemToAdd.body;
1819 	p_evt.target = p_evt.currentTarget = this;
1820 	this.sharedObject[newItemToAdd.itemID] = newItemToAdd.body;
1821 	this.dispatchEvent(p_evt);
1822 }
1823 
1824 /**
1825  * @private
1826  */
1827 SharedObject.prototype.itemRetract = function(p_evt)
1828 {
1829 	if (p_evt.nodeName!=this.nodeName) {
1830 		return;
1831 	}
1832 	var retractedItem = p_evt.item;
1833 	delete this.sharedObject[retractedItem.itemID];
1834 	p_evt.type = "propertyRetracted";
1835 	p_evt.itemID = retractedItem.itemID;
1836 	p_evt.value = retractedItem.body;
1837 	p_evt.target = p_evt.currentTarget = this;
1838 	this.dispatchEvent(p_evt);
1839 }

1922 /**
1923  * @class <code>SharedProperty</code> is a model that manages a 
1924  * variable of any type and which is shared amongst all users connected to the room.
1925  * <p>
1926  * Note that this component supports "piggybacking" on existing CollectionNodes 
1927  * through its constructor. Developers can avoid CollectionNode proliferation in 
1928  * their applications by pre-supplying a CollectionNode and a <code>nodeName</code> 
1929  * for the <code>SharedProperty</code> to use. If none is supplied, the SharedProperty 
1930  * will create its own <code>collectionNode</code> for sending and receiving messages.
1931  * <table><tr><th><b>Event</b></th><th><b>Summary</b></th></tr>
1932  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>change </code></td> <td> Dispatched when the value of the property is changed: it is subject to round tripping to the service.</td></tr>
1933  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>myRoleChange</code></td> <td> Dispatched when the user's role with respect to this SharedProperty  changes.</td></tr>
1934  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>synchronizationChange</code></td> <td> Dispatched when the SharedProperty goes in and out of sync.</td></tr>
1935  * </table>
1936  * @constructor
1937  */

1949  * is called; re-sessioning of components is not supported.

2020 /**
2021  * Cleans up all networking and event handling; it is recommended for garbage collection.
2022  * @function
2023  */
2024 SharedProperty.prototype.close = function()
2025 {
2026 	this.collectionNode.removeEventListener("synchronizationChange", this);	
2027 	this.collectionNode.removeEventListener("itemReceive", this);
2028 	this.collectionNode.removeEventListener("myRoleChange", this);			
2029 	this.collectionNode.unsubscribe();
2030 	this.collectionNode = null;
2031 	if (this.sendDataTimer) {
2032 		clearTimeout(this.sendDataTimer);
2033 		this.sendDataTimer = null;
2034 	}
2035 }

2037 /**
2038  * Tells the component to begin synchronizing with the service.  
2039  * For "headless" components such as this one, this method must be called explicitly.
2040  * @function
2041  */
2042 SharedProperty.prototype.subscribe = function()
2043 {
2044 	this.userManager = this.connectSession.userManager;
2045 	
2046 	if (this.collectionNode == null) {			
2047 		this.collectionNode = new CollectionNode();
2048 		this.collectionNode.connectSession = this.connectSession ;
2049 		this.collectionNode.sharedID =  this.sharedID  ;
2050 		this.collectionNode.subscribe();
2051 	} else {
2052 		if (this.collectionNode.isSynchronized) {
2053 			this.synchronizationChange("synchronizationChange");
2054 		}
2055 	}
2056 	this.collectionNode.addEventListener("synchronizationChange", this);	
2057 	this.collectionNode.addEventListener("itemReceive", this);
2058 	this.collectionNode.addEventListener("myRoleChange", this);
2059 }

2061 /**
2062  * The value of the SharedProperty which users can only set if <code>canUserEdit
2063  * </code> is true. 
2064  * @param p_value
2065  * @function
2066  */
2067 SharedProperty.prototype.setValue = function(p_value)
2068 {
2069 	if (p_value != this.value && this.collectionNode.isSynchronized) {
2070 		if (this.updateInterval != 0) {
2071 			this.cachedValueForSending = p_value;
2072 			if (this.sendDataTimer) {
2073 				clearTimeout(this.sendDataTimer);
2074 			}
2075 			this.sendDataTimer = setTimeout( bindUsingClosure(this.onTimerComplete,this), (this.updateInterval + 300));
2076 		} else {
2077 			var msg = new MessageItem();
2078 			msg.nodeName = this.nodeName;
2079 			msg.body = p_value;
2080 			this.collectionNode.publishItem(msg);
2081 		}
2082 	} else if (p_value != this.value) {
2083 		this.cachedValueForSync = p_value;
2084 	}
2085 }

2238 /**
2239  * @private
2240  */
2241 SharedProperty.prototype.synchronizationChange = function(p_evt)
2242 {
2243 	
2244 	if (this.collectionNode.isSynchronized) {
2245 		if (!this.collectionNode.isNodeDefined(this.nodeName)) {	//we're the first ones there
2246 			var nodeConf = new NodeConfiguration();
2247 			nodeConf.accessModel = 10;
2248 			nodeConf.publishModel = 50;
2249 			nodeConf.sessionDependentItems = this.isClearAfterSessionRemoved;
2250 			nodeConf.modifyAnyItem = true;
2251 			this.collectionNode.createNode(this.nodeName, nodeConf);
2252 			
2253 			if (this.cachedValueForSync) {
2254 				if (this.value == null) {					
2255 					this.setValue(this.cachedValueForSync);
2256 					this.cachedValueForSync = null;
2257 				}
2258 			} else {
2259 				if (this.value != null && this.itemReceived) {	//this happens on disconnect
2260 					//this is if you never got an item, you still want to say "I'm ready!"
2261 					this.value = null;
2262 					dispatchEvent("change");
2263 				}
2264 			}
2265 			
2266 		}
2267 		
2268 		if ( this.tempAccessModel != -1 || this.tempPublishModel != -1) {
2269 			if ( this.tempAccessModel != -1 ) {
2270 				this.accessModel = this.tempAccessModel ;
2271 				this.tempAccessModel = -1 ;
2272 			}
2273 			
2274 			if ( this.tempPublishModel != -1 ) {
2275 				this.publishModel = this.tempPublishModel ;
2276 				this.tempPublishModel = -1 ;
2277 			}
2278 			
2279 			this.commitProperties
2280 		}
2281 		
2282 	} else {
2283 		this.cachedValueForSync = null;
2284 		this.cachedValueForSending = null;
2285 		this.itemReceived = false;
2286 		clearTimeout(this.sendDataTimer)
2287 	}
2288 	p_evt.target = p_evt.currentTarget = this;
2289 	this.dispatchEvent(p_evt);
2290 }
2291 
2292 /**
2293  * @private
2294  */
2295 SharedProperty.prototype.itemReceive = function(p_evt)
2296 {
2297 	if (p_evt.item.nodeName == this.nodeName) {
2298 		this.value = p_evt.item.body;
2299 		this.itemReceived = true;
2300 		this.cachedValueForSync = null;
2301 		
2302 		var evt = new Object();
2303 		evt.type = "change";
2304 		evt.value = this.value ;
2305 		p_evt.target = p_evt.currentTarget = this;
2306 		this.dispatchEvent(evt);
2307 	}
2308 }
2309

2311  * @private
2312  */
2313 SharedProperty.prototype.myRoleChange = function(p_evt)
2314 {
2315 	//TODO: Peldi clean up my model if I have to?
2316 	p_evt.target = p_evt.currentTarget = this;
2317 	this.dispatchEvent(p_evt);
2318 }

2320 /**
2321  * @private
2322  */
2323 SharedProperty.prototype.commitProperties = function(p_evt)
2324 {	
2325 	var nodeConf;
2326 	if ( this.publishModel != -1 && this.collectionNode.getNodeConfiguration(this.nodeName).publishModel != this.publishModel ){
2327 		nodeConf = this.collectionNode.getNodeConfiguration(this.nodeName) ;
2328 		nodeConf.publishModel = this.publishModel ;
2329 		this.collectionNode.setNodeConfiguration(this.nodeName,nodeConf );
2330 	}
2331 	
2332 	if ( this.accessModel != -1 && this.collectionNode.getNodeConfiguration(this.nodeName).accessModel != _accessModel ){
2333 		nodeConf = this.collectionNode.getNodeConfiguration(this.nodeName) ;
2334 		nodeConf.accessModel = this.accessModel ;
2335 		this.collectionNode.setNodeConfiguration(this.nodeName, nodeConf ) ;
2336 	}
2337 }

2350 /**
2351  * @class Baton is a model class which provides a workflow between users. Essentially, it tracks the "holder" of a given resource and provides APIs for grabbing, putting down, and giving control to others. Users with an owner role always have the power to grab the baton, put it down, or give it to others regardless of who has the baton. Users with a publisher role must wait according to the grabbable property:
2352  *
2353  *    * If the baton is set to grabbable, they may grab the baton as soon as it is available (since it will then have no controller).
2354  *    * If the baton is not grabbable, the owner must explicitly pass the baton to someone else. 
2355  *
2356  * Note that users with an owner role may adjust the roles of other users relative to the baton using allowUserToGrab (which makes that user a publisher) and allowUserToAdminister (which makes that user an owner).
2357  *
2358  * This component also supports "piggybacking" on existing CollectionNodes through its constructor. Developers can avoid CollectionNode proliferation in their applications by pre-supplying a CollectionNode and a nodeName for the baton to use. If none is supplied, the baton will create its own collection node for sending and receiving messages.
2359  * <table><tr><th><b>Event</b></th><th><b>Summary</b></th></tr>
2360  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>batonHolderChange </code></td> <td> Dispatched when the baton is given to someone or put down.</td></tr>
2361  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>synchronizationChange</code></td> <td> Dispatched when the component has fully connected and synchronized with the service or when it loses the connection.</td></tr>
2362  * </table> 
2363  * @constructor
2364  */
2365 function Baton() {
2366 	this.connectSession = ConnectSession.primarySession;
2367 }
2368 
2369 /**
2370  * The the Node Name to which the value is published
2371  * @field
2372  */
2373 
2374 Baton.prototype.nodeName = "holderID";
2375 /**
2376  * The Collection Node to which the shared property subscribes/publishes
2377  * @field
2378  */
2379 
2380 Baton.prototype.collectionNode = undefined;
2381 /**
2382  * Specifies the <code>userID</code> of the person controlling the baton. Returns null if 
2383  * noone has the baton. For example, this function might be used to create a "controlled 
2384  * by XXX" tooltip for your component.
2385  * @field
2386  */
2387 Baton.prototype.holderID = undefined;
2388 /**
2389  * Defines the logical location of the component on the service - typically this assigns the sharedID of the collectionNode
2390  * used by the component. sharedIDs should be unique within a room (if they're expressing 2 unique locations). Note that
2391  * this can only be assigned once (before <code>subscribe()</code> is called). For components with an <code>id</code> property, 
2392  * sharedID defaults to that value.
2393  * @field
2394  */
2395 Baton.prototype.sharedID = "Baton";
2396 /**
2397  * @private
2398  */
2399 Baton.prototype.pubModelForControlling = 50;
2400 /**
2401  * @private
2402  */
2403 Baton.prototype.pubModelForYanking = 100;
2404 /**
2405  * @private
2406  */
2407 Baton.prototype.cachedBatonHolderID;
2408 /**
2409  * @private
2410  */
2411 Baton.prototype.userManager;
2412 /**
2413  * @private
2414  */
2415 Baton.prototype.inSync = false;		
2416 /**
2417  * @private
2418  */
2419 Baton.prototype.yankable = true;
2420 /**
2421  * @private
2422  */
2423 Baton.prototype.grabbable = true;
2424 /**
2425  * Role value which is required for seeing the baton
2426  * @field
2427  */
2428 Baton.prototype.accessModel = -1 ;
2429 /**
2430  * Role value which is required for publishing to the baton
2431  * @field
2432  */
2433 Baton.prototype.publishModel = -1 ;
2434 /**
2435  * The ConnectSession with which this component is associated. Note that this may only be set once before <code>subscribe</code>
2436  * is called; re-sessioning of components is not supported.
2437  * @field
2438  */
2439 Baton.prototype.connectSession = undefined;
2440 /**
2441  * Number of seconds after which the baton times out
2442  * @field
2443  */ 
2444 Baton.prototype.timeOut = undefined;

2446  * @private
2447  */
2448 Baton.prototype.autoPutDownTimer;

2452 /**
2453  * Tells the component to begin synchronizing with the service.  
2454  * This method must be called explicitly.
2455  * @function
2456  */
2457 Baton.prototype.subscribe = function()
2458 {
2459 	this.userManager = this.connectSession.userManager;
2460 	//this.autoPutDownTimer=setTimeout(this.onTimerComplete,this.timeOut*1000,this);
2461 	if (!this.collectionNode) {			
2462 		this.collectionNode = new CollectionNode();
2463 		this.collectionNode.sharedID = this.sharedID  ;
2464 		this.collectionNode.connectSession = this.connectSession ;
2465 		this.collectionNode.subscribe();
2466 	} else {
2467 		if (this.collectionNode.isSynchronized) {
2468 			this.synchronizationChange("synchronizationChange");
2469 		}
2470 	}
2471 	this.collectionNode.addEventListener("synchronizationChange", this);				
2472 	this.collectionNode.addEventListener("itemReceive", this);
2473 	this.collectionNode.addEventListener("itemRetract", this);
2474 }

2481 Baton.prototype.getNodeConfiguration = function()

2573 /**

2600  * @function
2601  */
2602 Baton.prototype.canUserGrab = function(p_userID)

2605 }

2607 /**
2608  * When called by an owner, <code>setUserRole()</code> sets the role of the specified 
2609  * user with respect to this baton. The following rules apply: 
2610  * <ul>
2611  * <li>Setting the role to <code>UserRoles.PUBLISHER</code> allows the user to grab the baton. </li>
2612  * <li>Setting the role to <code>UserRoles.OWNER</code> allows the user to administer the baton.</li> 
2613  * <li>Setting to <code>UserRoles.VIEWER</code> will allow neither.</li>
2614  * </ul>
2615  * 
2616  * @param p_userID The <code>userID</code> of the user to set the role for. 
2617  * @param p_role The new role for that user.
2618  * @function
2619  */
2620 Baton.prototype.setUserRole = function(p_userID, p_role)
2621 {
2622 	if ( p_userID != null )
2623 	{
2624 		if ( (p_role > 0 && p_role <= 100) && p_role != -999 )
2625 		{
2626 			this.collectionNode.setUserRole(p_userID, p_role, this.nodeName);
2627 		}
2628 	}
2629 }

2634  * @function

2636 Baton.prototype.amIHolding = function()
2637 {
2638 	return (this.holderID == this.userManager.myUserID);
2639 }

2641 /**
2642  * Determines whether the baton is up for grabs because it has no current holder.
2643  * @function
2644  */
2645 Baton.prototype.available = function()
2646 {
2647 	return ((this.holderID == null) && this.grabbable);
2648 }

2657 	this.collectionNode = null;

2660 /**
2661  * If grabbable, users with a publisher role can grab the control if it's available 
2662  * by using this method. Users with an owner role may grab the baton at any time.
2663  * @function
2664  */
2665 Baton.prototype.grab = function()
2666 {
2667 	if (!this.canIAdminister()) {
2668 		// if I can Yank, don't worry about other
2669 		if ( !this.available() || !this.canIGrab()) {
2670 			return;
2671 		}
2672 	}
2673 	
2674 	if ( this.amIHolding() ) {
2675 		return;
2676 	}
2677 	
2678 	if ( this.isSynchronized() ) {
2679 		var msgItem = new MessageItem();
2680 		msgItem.nodeName =  this.nodeName;
2681 		msgItem.body = this.userManager.myUserID;
2682 		this.collectionNode.publishItem(msgItem);
2683 	} else {
2684 		this.cachedBatonHolderID = this.userManager.myUserID;
2685 	}
2686 }
2687 
2688 /**
2689  * Users with an publisher role in control can use this method to 
2690  * release their control. Users with an owner role  can use this method 
2691  * to remove the baton from a user who has it.
2692  * @function
2693  */
2694 Baton.prototype.putDown = function()
2695 {
2696 	if ( this.available() ) {
2697 		return;
2698 	}
2699 	
2700 	if (!this.canIAdminister() && !this.amIHolding()) {
2701 		return;
2702 	}			
2703 	if ( this.isSynchronized() ) {				
2704 		this.collectionNode.retractItem(this.nodeName);
2705 	}
2706 }
2707 
2708 /**
2709  * If the baton is grabbable, the holding user can hand the baton to a specified user. 
2710  * A user with an owner role can give a baton to anyone with the required permissions 
2711  * at any time.
2712  * 
2713  * @param p_userID  The <code>userID</code> of the user to allow to grab the baton.
2714  * @function
2715  */
2716 Baton.prototype.giveTo = function(p_userID)
2717 {
2718 	if (!this.canIAdminister() && (!this.grabbable || !this.amIHolding())) {
2719 		return;
2720 	}
2721 	
2722 	if ( this.isSynchronized() ) {
2723 		var msgItem = new MessageItem();
2724 		msgItem.nodeName =  this.nodeName;
2725 		msgItem.body = p_userID;
2726 		this.collectionNode.publishItem(msgItem);
2727 	} else {
2728 		this.cachedBatonHolderID = p_userID;
2729 	}
2730 }
2731 
2732 /**
2733  *@private
2734  */
2735 Baton.prototype.synchronizationChange = function(p_evt)
2736 {						
2737 	if (this.isSynchronized()) {
2738 		if (!this.collectionNode.isNodeDefined(this.nodeName)) {	//we're the first ones here
2739 			var nodeConf = new NodeConfiguration();
2740 			nodeConf.accessModel = 10;
2741 			nodeConf.publishModel = this.pubModelForControlling;
2742 			nodeConf.modifyAnyItem = true;
2743 			nodeConf.userDependentItems = true;
2744 			this.collectionNode.createNode(this.nodeName, nodeConf);
2745 		}
2746 		
2747 		if (this.holderID == null && this.cachedBatonHolderID != null) {	//this will work but I don't like it...we might want to use this.holderIDSetFromNetwork
2748 			if ( this.getUserRole(this.userManager.myUserID) >= this.pubModelForYanking ) {
2749 				this.giveTo(this.cachedBatonHolderID);
2750 			} else if ( this.canIGrab() && this.cachedBatonHolderID == this.userManager.myUserID ) {
2751 				this.grab();
2752 			}
2753 			this.cachedBatonHolderID = null;
2754 		}
2755 	} else {
2756 		clearTimeout(this.autoPutDownTimer);
2757 		this.cachedBatonHolderID = null;
2758 		this.holderID = null;
2759 	}
2760 	p_evt.currentTarget = p_evt.target = this;
2761 	this.dispatchEvent(p_evt);	//bubble it
2762 }
2763 
2764 /**
2765  *@private
2766  */
2767 Baton.prototype.itemReceive = function(p_evt)
2768 {
2769 	var theItem = p_evt.item;
2770 	
2771 	if (theItem.nodeName == this.nodeName) {
2772 		this.holderID = theItem.body;	
2773 		this.cachedBatonHolderID = null;
2774 		if (this.amIHolding() && this.timeOut>0) {
2775 			this.autoPutDownTimer = setTimeout( bindUsingClosure(this.onTimerComplete,this), (this.timeOut*1000));
2776 		}
2777 		p_evt.currentTarget = p_evt.target = this;
2778 		p_evt.type = "batonHolderChange";
2779 		this.dispatchEvent(p_evt);
2780 	}			
2781 }
2782 
2783 /**
2784  *@private
2785  */
2786 Baton.prototype.itemRetract = function(p_evt)
2787 {
2788 	if (p_evt.nodeName == this.nodeName) {			//no need to check the itemID, I only have one
2789 		this.holderID = null;
2790 		this.cachedBatonHolderID = null;
2791 		p_evt.currentTarget = p_evt.target = this;
2792 		p_evt.type = "batonHolderChange";
2793 		clearTimeout(this.autoPutDownTimer);
2794 		this.dispatchEvent(p_evt);
2795 	}
2796 }
2797 
2798 
2799 /**
2800  *@private
2801  */
2802 Baton.prototype.commitProperties = function(p_evt)
2803 {	
2804 	var nodeConf;
2805 	if ( this.publishModel != -1 && this.collectionNode.getNodeConfiguration(this.nodeName).publishModel != this.publishModel ){
2806 		nodeConf = this.collectionNode.getNodeConfiguration(this.nodeName) ;
2807 		nodeConf.publishModel = this.publishModel ;
2808 		this.collectionNode.setNodeConfiguration(this.nodeName,nodeConf );
2809 	}
2810 	
2811 	if ( this.accessModel != -1 && this.collectionNode.getNodeConfiguration(this.nodeName).accessModel != this.accessModel ){
2812 		nodeConf = this.collectionNode.getNodeConfiguration(this.nodeName) ;
2813 		nodeConf.accessModel = this.accessModel ;
2814 		this.collectionNode.setNodeConfiguration(this.nodeName, nodeConf ) ;
2815 	}
2816 	
2817 }
2818 
2819 /**
2820  *@private
2821  */
2822 Baton.prototype.onTimerComplete = function(args)
2823 {
2824 	args.collectionNode.retractItem(args.nodeName);
2825 }

2827 /**
2828  * Extends the timeout if the baton has one. 
2829  */
2830 Baton.prototype.extendTimer = function()
2831 {
2832 	if (this.autoPutDownTimer) {
2833 		clearTimeout(this.autoPutDownTimer);
2834 		this.autoPutDownTimer = null;
2835 		this.autoPutDownTimer = setTimeout( bindUsingClosure(this.onTimerComplete,this), (this.timeOut*1000));
2836 	}
2837 }

2839 /**
2840  * @class BatonProperty is a model component which manages a property of any type that 
2841  * only one user can edit at a time. It exposes a standard Baton component to 
2842  * manage this workflow.
2843  * <p>
2844  * This component supports "piggybacking" on existing CollectionNodes through its 
2845  * constructor. Developers can avoid CollectionNode proliferation in their applications
2846  * by pre-supplying a CollectionNode and a <code>nodeName</code> for the <code>
2847  * BatonProperty</code> to use. If none is supplied, the <code>BatonProperty</code> will 
2848  * create its own CollectionNode for sending and receiving messages.
2849  * <table><tr><th><b>Event</b></th><th><b>Summary</b></th></tr>
2850  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>batonHolderChange </code></td> <td> Dispatched when the baton holder for the string is assigned or when the string becomes available.</td></tr>
2851  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>change </code></td> <td> Dispatched when the value of the property is changed: it is subject to round tripping to the service.</td></tr>
2852  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>myRoleChange</code></td> <td> Dispatched when the user's role with respect to this SharedProperty  changes.</td></tr>
2853  * <tr><td valign="top"><code>synchronizationChange</code></td> <td> Dispatched when the SharedProperty goes in and out of sync.</td></tr>
2854  * </table> 
2855  * @constructor
2856  */
2857 function BatonProperty() {
2858 	this.baton = new Baton();
2859 	this.connectSession = ConnectSession.primarySession;
2860 }
2861

2863  *@private
2864  */

2878 BatonProperty.prototype.nodeNameResource = "cID";
2879 /**
2880  * Defines the logical location of the component on the service - typically this assigns the sharedID of the collectionNode
2881  * used by the component. If this is used to "piggyback" on an existing collectionNode, sharedID specifies the nodeName
2882  * to use for the property itself. sharedIDs should be unique within a room (if they're expressing 2 unique locations). Note that
2883  * this can only be assigned once (before <code>subscribe()</code> is called). For components with an <code>id</code> property, 
2884  * sharedID defaults to that value.
2885  * @field

2921  * For "headless" components such as this one, this method must be called explicitly.
2922  * @function
2923  */

2925 {

2929 	this.baton.nodeName = this.nodeNameResource ;

2932 	this.baton.subscribe();

2947 /**
2948  * The value of the BatonProperty which a user can only set it if the user is in 
2949  * control of it.
2950  * <p>
2951  * If the BatonProperty is not yet synchrnonized, the value will be cached and 
2952  * sent when the BatonProperty is back in sync.
2953  * <p>
2954  * If the BatonProperty is available, setting the value will also try to grab 
2955  * control of the BatonProperty before setting the text.
2956  * @function
2957  */
2958 BatonProperty.prototype.setValue = function(p_value)
2959 {
2960 	if (p_value == this.value) {	//no need to set it again
2961 		return;
2962 	}
2963 	
2964 	if (this.collectionNode.isSynchronized) {
2965 		if (this.baton.amIHolding()) {
2966 			this.cachedValueForSending = p_value;
2967 			this.sendDataTimer = setTimeout( bindUsingClosure(this.onTimerComplete,this), (this.updateInterval + 300));
2968 			this.baton.extendTimer();
2969 		} else if (this.baton.available()) {
2970 			if (!this.cachedValueForToggle) {	//only toggle the first time
2971 				this.baton.grab();
2972 			}
2973 			this.cachedValueForToggle = p_value;	//overwrite the value that will eventually be published
2974 		}
2975 	} else {
2976 		this.cachedValueForSync = p_value;
2977 	}
2978 }
2979 
2980 /**
2981  * @private
2982  */
2983 BatonProperty.prototype.batonHolderChange = function(p_evt)
2984 {
2985 	if (this.baton.amIHolding() && this.cachedValueForToggle) {
2986 		this.setValue(this.cachedValueForToggle);
2987 		this.cachedValueForToggle = null;
2988 	}
2989 	p_evt.currentTarget = p_evt.target = this;
2990 	this.dispatchEvent(p_evt);
2991 }

2994  * @private
2995  */

2997 {
2998 	if (this.collectionNode.isSynchronized) {
2999 	} else {
3000 		//clear model
3001 		this.cachedValueForToggle = null;
3002 	}
3003 	var args = new Array();
3004 	args.push(p_evt);
3005 	SharedProperty.prototype.synchronizationChange.apply(this,args);
3006 }
